direct_answer.text: Let's think step by step. If $(x-1)\cdot f(x) = g(x)$, then the highest power term in both polynomials comes from multiplying together terms involving the variable x raised to some power p times itself also raised to the same power q=(pq): \[\begin{aligned} & ((x-1)f(x))\\ &=x^{p+1}\cdot f_{p}(x)+..\ldots+a_{-r}\\&g(x)=b_{k}^{p+1}+...+c_{-r}, b_{j}>0, k=degree \,of\, g \\ &\Rightarrow degre\,e\,f=\{PQ\}+\text {other constants}=4+1=5 .\end{aligned} \] Therefore, the degree of $f$ is $\boxed{5}$. The answer is: 5.
